marketNews.title: BI Projects Indonesia Economy +5.3% in 2026
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo said that the central bank forecasts Indonesia's economic growth in 2026 to be around +4.7-5.5% year-on-year, with a tendency to be at the +5.3% level as interest rates decline. This projection is higher than the Bank Indonesia forecast for 2025 at +5.1% YoY. Compared with other institutions, the BI projection for 2026 is lower than the government target in the 2026 RAPBN at +5.4% YoY, but higher than the Bloomberg consensus survey in August 2025 at +4.9% YoY and the IMF projection in July 2025 at +4.8% YoY. In line with the growth projection, Perry said the central bank expects banking credit growth to be in the +9-12% YoY range in 2026, higher than the +8-11% YoY projection for this year. The 2026 growth projection is based on monetary and fiscal policy directions: 1. Monetary Policy – Perry stated that Bank Indonesia continues to look for space to cut interest rates further given low inflation, a stable rupiah and the need to boost growth. Bloomberg consensus also expects a further BI Rate cut of -25 basis points to 4.75% by the end of 2025 and another -25 basis points throughout 2026. 2. Fiscal Policy – According to the 2026 RAPBN, consumption and investment are expected to drive growth, with consumption projected to grow +5.2% YoY (vs. the 2025 APBN outlook of +4.7-5% YoY) and investment also projected to grow +5.2% YoY (vs. the 2025 APBN outlook of +4.5-4.7% YoY). Priority programs in the 2026 RAPBN focus on supporting purchasing power, including free nutritious meals, the Red-White Village Cooperatives, and food and energy security. To finance government programs, Bank Indonesia has signed a new burden-sharing agreement with the government, although details on the duration of the scheme and the amount of government bonds to be covered by BI have not been disclosed. Investment is also expected to be boosted by the presence of Danantara. To support spending, the 2026 RAPBN targets a +9.8% YoY increase in state revenue, supported by a +13% YoY rise in tax receipts. Finance Minister Sri Mulyani affirmed that the government will not introduce new taxes or raise tax rates in 2026, but will instead encourage better taxpayer compliance.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The government's success in boosting economic growth could become a key factor for the return of foreign investor inflows to the IDX significantly. Since the beginning of the year, the IDX has recorded net foreign outflow of about 55 trillion rupiah per Thursday (4/9).

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics
marketNews.content:
1. US President Donald Trump said he will file an appeal to the Supreme Court as early as Wednesday (3/9) regarding the reciprocal tariff dispute. The statement came after the US Federal Court of Appeals for the Federal District ruled on Friday (29/8) that the reciprocal tariff violates Trump's emergency powers as president. The appellate court did not overturn the tariff, which will remain in effect at least until 14 October 2025 to give the US government time to appeal. Six of the nine Supreme Court justices were appointed by the Republican Party, so Trump still has a chance to maintain the tariff.
2. The US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that job openings in July 2025 fell by 176,000 to 7.18 million, the lowest level since September 2024 and well below the consensus expectation of 7.4 million. June 2025 openings were also revised down by 80,000 to 7.36 million. The BLS also revised up the number of people experiencing layoffs in June 2025 by 192,000 to about 1.8 million.
3. Bloomberg surveyed that Malaysia's palm-oil stock rose +2.8% month-on-month in August 2025 to 2.17 million tonnes, the highest since December 2023 and continuing a six-month upward trend. Crude palm-oil production in Malaysia in August 2025 is estimated to increase +2.2% month-on-month to 1.85 million tonnes, the highest in a year, while exports are projected to jump +11% month-on-month to 1.45 million tonnes. The higher supply could pressure CPO futures prices, especially during the high-production cycle that usually peaks in October.
4. Kompas reported that the Attorney General's Office on Thursday (4/9) named former Education, Culture, Research and Technology Minister Nadiem Makarim as a suspect in a corruption case involving the procurement of Chromebook-based laptops. The head of the AG's Public Information Center, Anang Supriatna, said Nadiem was named a suspect after examining around 120 witnesses and four experts.
5. Amman Mineral International (AMMN) commissioner Alexander Ramlie bought approximately 230 million AMMN shares at an average price of 8,070 rupiah per share between 28 August and 1 September 2025, a transaction worth about 1.9 trillion rupiah aimed at restructuring share collateral. After this transaction, Ramlie's ownership rose from 0.145% to 0.462%. Previously, Ramlie sold about 283 million AMMN shares for roughly 2.3 trillion rupiah on 26 August 2025.

tickerNews.title: OASA Private Placement for Waste Processing Project
tickerNews.content: OASA (Maharaksa Biru Energi) plans a private placement of approximately 634.7 million shares (10%) at a price yet to be announced. The proceeds will be used for business development and will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 8 September 2025. Part of the funds will be allocated to a waste-to-energy project in South Tangerang, to be executed by a joint venture between OASA and China Tianying Inc. OASA will hold 76% of the joint venture. The project has a capacity of 19.6 MW, an investment value of 2.65 trillion rupiah, and the generated electricity will be sold to PLN under a 27-year power purchase agreement.

tickerNews.title: ARCI Targets 10x Net Profit Growth and Dividend
tickerNews.content: Arci Indonesia's CEO Rudy Suhendra said the company could record a ten-fold increase in net profit to around USD 100 million in 2025, driven by higher gold prices and sales volume. This profit surge could enable dividend distribution in 2026. ARCI aims to increase gold production or sales by about +25% YoY through the end of 2025. In the first half of 2025, ARCI's gold sales volume rose +5% YoY to 49,200 troy ounces, and the average selling price increased +41% YoY to USD 3,128 per troy ounce.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Denies Synergy with CBRE
tickerNews.content: Petrosea clarified to the IDX that rumors of a synergy between its subsidiary group Hafar and Cakra Buana Resources Energi (CBRE) are unfounded. Earlier reports suggested a stronger partnership between CBRE and Hafar Offshore following CBRE's plan to acquire a pipe-laying & lifting vessel.

tickerNews.title: BRPT Denies Acquisition of BUVA
tickerNews.content: Barito Pacific issued a clarification stating that it is not in discussions to acquire Bukit Uluwatu Villa (BUVA). The company urged the public to be cautious about unverified rumors that do not originate from official sources.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Announces Share Buyback Programs
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi International announced a share buyback of up to 407 million shares (1.62%) with a funding allocation of up to 815 billion rupiah for the period 8 September 2025 to 8 December 2025. This buyback follows a previous program for the period 26 March to 25 June 2025, enabled by the OJK's relaxed buyback regulations. Additionally, MEDC is conducting another buyback of up to 240 million shares (0.95%) with a funding allocation of up to 408 billion rupiah for the period 4 June 2025 to 3 June 2026, approved at the shareholders meeting in June 2025. Combined, the maximum buyback funding reaches approximately 1.2 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: TOWR Plans Share Buyback
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara intends to execute a share buyback of up to 296 million shares (approximately 0.5%) with a funding allocation of up to 200 billion rupiah for the period 4 September to 3 December 2025. The plan does not require shareholder meeting approval, reflecting the OJK's relaxed regulations to support market stability.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Commissioner Purchases Shares
tickerNews.content: Amman Mineral International (AMMN) commissioner Alexander Ramlie bought approximately 230 million AMMN shares at an average price of 8,070 rupiah per share between 28 August and 1 September 2025, a transaction valued at about 1.9 trillion rupiah for share collateral restructuring. After the purchase, Ramlie's ownership increased from 0.145% to 0.462%. Previously, on 26 August 2025, he sold around 283 million AMMN shares for roughly 2.3 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: BNBR Plans Acquisition of PT Cimanggis Cibitung Tollways
tickerNews.content: Bakrie & Brothers (BNBR), through its subsidiary PT Bakrie Toll Indonesia, plans to acquire 90% of PT Cimanggis Cibitung Tollways for a total consideration of 3.6 trillion rupiah, comprising 1 trillion rupiah for the shares and 2.6 trillion rupiah for receivables from PT Waskita Toll Road and PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur. To finance the transaction, PT Bakrie Toll Indonesia will sign a loan facility of approximately 5.1 trillion rupiah (about 312 million USD) with ADH Jackpot SPV Limited, a subsidiary of Alpha Dhabi Holding PJSC. The loan carries an interest rate of up to 20% per annum, a tenor of five years with a possible two-year extension, and will be used for bridging loans, convertible shareholder loans, and operational shareholder loans to PT Cimanggis Cibitung Tollways.
